reviews.review: Great game!!!!!... but.... its really long to the point where I got bored of testing
多年之前玩的传送门一，一直没玩二，这一次看见夏促二话不说把遗憾补上了。没话说，好游戏。当你不查攻略自己玩通关，你才会知道这个游戏的魅力何在。最后说一句，请G胖快点学会数三。
有一说一，一个可玩性极强的解谜类游戏，综合了FPS的操作与打击感，同时又融入了解密环节。剧情方面衔接一代，反转颇多，让玩家仿佛身临其境，最终的结局更是创意十足，给人以充足的想象空间。画质优良，操作流畅，很难想象这是一部这么早之前发行的游戏。好评！
Good game. Legendary. It's portal 2. Everyone likes it.

[b] 名称：传送门2 [/b]

[i] 《传送门》是PC游戏史上的经典IP之一，本作作为2代在口碑上甚至要比鼎鼎大名的1代更加辉煌，在解谜游戏中有着较为重要的地位。甚至有传言称该作品发布当日，发生了某大学学生们为了体验本作，集体称病告假，教授最终妥协临时停课一天的事件。 [/i]

[h1] 以“承接”而入 [/h1]

游戏剧情承接前作：即将逃走却被拽回『光圈科技公司』的女主角『Chell』，要在新角色『Wheatley』的指引下再次从人工智能的杀人实验中逃脱，然而事情并不像表面那样简单……

1代的未来科幻风格和黑色幽默得到了完美传承，还记得前作中『GlaDos』（G姐）犀利的毒舌么？2代中它又阴魂不散的回来了，欧耶！在本作玩家得以一窥实验室之外的世界，体验更宏大的场景和更震撼的演出，让游戏从“情景剧”的小格局上升到“电影大片”。

《传送门2》基本沿袭前作的玩法框架，并添加了各种凝胶拓展解谜规则，从初始引导到深入应用的关卡设计愈加精进，几小时的流程长度与1代相仿，但本作正式支持了创意工坊，如果通关后意犹未尽，还可以试试该游戏的知名Mod《Portal Stories: Mel》（传送门故事：梅尔）。游戏核心的“空间移动”谜题机制仍然不变，解谜体验与前作没有太大差异，在创新层面欠了点1代中灵光乍现的惊喜感。

此外，本作甚至还提供了一套完全不同于单人模式的双人合作关卡，理论上特别适合小两口携手游玩、培养感情，不过其难度相较单人也是飙升，有兴趣、有耐心、有感情、有配合还有智商能共同破关的狗男女凑到一块究竟是怎样一种画面？实是难以想象，难以想象。

有关背景设定、艺术风格和游戏性的相关内容在前作的评测中已有提及，本作中不再赘述，有兴趣可以翻看本人对于一代的具体介绍：[url=steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198167704316/recommended/400?snr=1_5_9__402][/url]

[h1] 由“延展”而出 [/h1]

游戏的明线剧情依然采用与前作相似的“逃生”情节作为故事主干，但在此基础上，2代的精髓在于通过透露大量背景讯息，补完《传送门》中庞大的历史设定，将这个反乌托邦末世全面向玩家全面铺开，在此过程中让『光圈科技』相关的暗线剧情逐渐水落石出。这条故事线也终于交代了G姐虽是反派，却对主角总是爱恨交加、若即若离的真正原因。

游戏藉由『光圈科技』的历史引出俩个关键角色，即使没能真正露脸，却成为了整个故事的主轴：公司创始人『Jonson』象征着人类追求升华抛弃一切，而助理『Caroline』则代表人性中最不可或缺的元素—爱，矛盾的情感最终汇聚成可能是史上最迷人的AI『GlaDos』，看似冷漠的态度掩盖不住残存的那一点儿人味儿，恰到好处的将这个腹黑的AI程序刻画成傲娇但不圣母的性格。

然后在变成『PotatOS』之后真是太可爱了，卧槽，太可爱了。

《传送门》的故事散发着20世纪六七十年代新浪潮时代科幻文学气息：着眼于当前社会发展，带有对心理学、社会学、政治学的探讨，1代更多展现科技进步促成社会快速发展的隐忧，而到了2代则将主题延展到人的层面，让整个故事诞生于人性、超越于人性、回归于人性、升华于人性。

[b] 推荐歌单： [/b]

·《Want You Gone》
二代的主题曲，与《Still alive》同样调皮的曲调、同样恶毒的歌词、同样莫得感情的电子声线，经过全新的演绎，除了原有的嘲讽意味之外，仿佛多了一丝无奈和一丝不舍，复杂的矛盾情感更加凸显出G姐的傲娇女王气质。

·《Cara Mia Addio！》
萌死人的炮塔大合唱，电子声线的美声女高音你听过没？

[b] Tips： [/b]
·游戏中还有另一条隐藏剧情线“鼠人”，有关这段故事在官方漫画中有所讲述。

Portal 2 является очень достойным наследником первой части. Так как первый Portal мне понравился, то перед второй частью у меня просто не было шансов устоять.
Во-первых, увеличилось количество механик, что добавило разнообразия и немного усложнило игру. В некоторых моментах просто путаешься с чего именно тебе нужно начать.
Во-вторых, сюжет стал длиннее и более полноценный. Появилось еще больше пасхалок.
В-третьих, плюсом стало добавление кооператива, который к сожалению я еще не проходил, так что ничего сказать о нем не могу.
В итоге я вам конечно же советую купить эту игру. Вы даже не поверите насколько обычная головоломка в грамотной обертке может заинтересовать игрока. А лучше купить сразу 2 части, так вы лучше поймете сюжет и получите больше удовольствия
This game is everything the first portal was, but more.  10/10 would play again.
Primero tenes que jugar al Portal porque si no no vas a entender la historia. La jugabilidad y los puzzles son similares y, diria yo, que más complicados.
Игра прикольная но одному будет скучно
Nice Campaign Brilliant voice acting and a good twist

где фанаты игры выкладывают свои карты для мастерской. Рекомендую пройти
этот шедевр всем любителям головоломок.

Better than the first. Portal 2 builds upon the first game and adds extra characters to the story. The game is much longer than the first and shows you the deep dark history of the Aperture Science Labratory with extra references to the Half Life universe. New game mechanics are added to the puzzles to make them more interesting and challenging. Anyone who hasn't should get both Portal and Portal 2.

Easily the most creative level design, very high replay value, and I mean seriously its portal you can't not like it. I always find myself coming back to this game when I'm bored, it's truly a great game, and shows that even the simplest concepts can make one of the most memorable and original games I have ever played. I highly recommend Portal 2, easily better than the first and if you are looking for a great game that is different I highly suggest this. Also I usually play fps games mainly COD, Destiny, and R6, and this game is far from something I would usually enjoy. It really does not matter if you like puzzle games, I originally had this for ps3 and didn't like it, but got it for PC like 7 years later and I love it now. No matter hat game you play I definitely recommend.

Gameplay, écriture, tout y'est, un chef d'oeuvre de Valve.

As for a sequel, this game is great! It has all the elements that portal 1 had, plus MORE! If you want a puzzle game with lots of action, a FANTASTIC story, and also great graphics, you should buy this game. And remember

When life gives you lemons, don't make lemonade! Make life take the lemons back! Get mad! I don't want your damn lemons! What am I supposed to do with these? Demand to see life's manager!
Make life rue the day it thought it could give Cave Johnson lemons! Do you know who I am? I'm the man whose gonna burn your house down - with the lemons!

(NOTE: I have not played this game for 34 hours, that's my fault for not closing the game before I went to bed multiple times, haha. I think I've played for closer to 14ish-18ish hours? Not sure.)

I love this game, I really do. I see a lot of reviews saying this is worse than the original for multiple reasons, and I wanna comment on some of them. (Even though most agree it's still a good game.)

"There's only one way to solve each puzzle." Maybe this is true if you're actually good at video games, but trust me, after watching playthroughs after I finished, I think I found the wrong way to solve a solid 10+ puzzles. Don't ask my how I did it. I don't know.

"Wheatley ruins the mood." I get this, if you really loved the feeling of Portal 1. It was cool, I agree. I felt totally weirded out while I was playing it at 11pm. I didn't wanna go through a whole other game feeling like this though. I already knew the plot twist of the game, but I was still super depressed after the fact. [spoiler] All those times he randomly popped up during the first half of the game were some of my favorite moments. Before getting in the lift during the climax, I just kinda sat there super upset, not ready to watch his betrayal for myself. My thought is that it's not Wheatley's, or even GLaDOS's fault, that it's something in the machine instead, because even GLaDOS's became rather understanding and thoughtful as potatOS, and disconnected from the big machine thing. But who knows, that's just me probably. [/spoiler]

TLDR: Great game, please go play it. I thought nine years was way to late to play this, but it honestly didn't matter. I'm just gonna sit here for the next 10 years waiting for a third one now...
